justification: “the participants needed to complete the Interactive Mentalizing Questionnaire (IMQ) [12] which evaluates the mentalizing ability of the participants” clearly links overall mentalizing ability with the IMQ as its measurement tool.
The article states that the IMQ "measures self-self mentalization (SS) …" indicating that the SS sub-score of the IMQ operationalizes this construct.
It is explicitly noted that the IMQ includes a component that "measures … self-other (SO)" mentalization, so the SO score functions as the measure for this construct.
The text specifies that the IMQ "measures … other-self mentalization (OS)", meaning the OS score is the instrument for assessing this construct.
